title: US Cities Geography game
description: Geography game to learn about US cities

San Francisco.name: San Francisco
San Francisco.description: San Francisco, officially the City and County of San Francisco, is the cultural, commercial, and financial center of Northern California

tidbits: the Frommer's travel guide describes it as possibly the most beautiful, certainly the most photographed, bridge in the world
one of the most iconic bridges in the United States, and has been called one of the Seven Wonders of the Modern World
if you untangled all of its cables, they would stretch around the world 3 times
developed with facilities for a lighthouse, a military fortification, a military prison
it had a federal prison from 1934 to 1963
during its 29 years of operation, the penitentiary claimed that no prisoner successfully escaped
the street is famous for a steep, one-block section with eight hairpin turns.
the famous one-block section, claimed to be "the crookedest street in the world"
famous for sea lions.
where you can take a cruise to under a famous bridge.
world's last manually operated cable car system.

New York City.name: New York City
New York City.description: The City of New York, often called New York City or simply New York, is the most populous city in the United States

tidbits: the copper statue, a gift from the people of France to the people of the United States.
a hybrid cable-stayed/suspension bridge and is one of the oldest roadway bridges in the United States.
sprawling park with pedestrian paths & ballfields, plus a zoo, carousel, boat rentals & a reservoir.
one of the world's busiest pedestrian areas, it is sometimes referred to as "The Crossroads of the World".

Washington, D.C..name: Washington, D.C.
Washington, D.C..description: Washington, D.C., formally the District of Columbia and commonly referred to as Washington or D.C., is the capital of the United States of America
nicknames: The Capital of the Free World

tidbits: official residence and workplace of the President of the United States.
a long, grassy area that is home to iconic monuments including the Lincoln Memorial and the Washington Monument.
home of the United States Congress, and the seat of the legislative branch of the U.S. federal government.
an obelisk on the National Mall, built to commemorate George Washington, the first President of the United States.
a group of museums and research centers administered by the Government of the United States.

Los Angeles.name: Los Angeles
Los Angeles.description: Los Angeles is the cultural, financial, and commercial center of Southern California.

tidbits: an iconic amusement park with rides, shows & costumed characters.
it comprises more than 2,600 five-pointed terrazzo and brass stars embedded in the sidewalks along 15 blocks of Hollywood Boulevard
ice Age–fossil excavation site with an adjacent museum, plus a re-created prehistoric garden.
a public observatory which offers a planetarium, exhibits, public telescopes, and the best views of the Los Angeles basin.

nicknames: The City of the Big Shoulders

Kansas City.name: Kansas City
Kansas City.description: Kansas City is a large, major midwestern city on the border of Missouri and Kansas and the largest city in Missouri

tidbits: features one of the nation's largest collection of antique toys and the world's largest collection of contemporary, fine-scale miniatures.
the museum is a favorite city attraction, a history museum housing 200 tons of cargo from life on the American frontier in 1856.
recognized as one of America’s finest art museums, strives to be the place where the power of art engages the spirit of community.
the memorial and museum is America's leading institution dedicated to remembering, interpreting and understanding the Great War and its enduring impact on the global community.
a tribute to all things "Wizard of Oz", from original book & 1939 movie to Michael Jackson remake.

New Orleans.name: New Orleans
New Orleans.description: New Orleans is one of nation's oldest cities where you'll find the roots of jazz and a blossoming culture that has been long described as being unlike anything else in the United States

tidbits: the major landmark of the French Quarter is the oldest continuously active cathedral in the U.S.
the heart and cultural center of the city is the French Quarter, a must-see for its high energy, rich history, diverse architecture, music, street performers, renowned jazz clubs.
airboat ride of South Louisiana bayous and swamps.
artists & performers ply their trades in a park built in 1721 & lined with historic buildings.
vast, 400,000-sq.-ft. complex where Mardi Gras floats are made & stored, with hourly tours.

Austin.name: Austin
Austin.description: Austin is the capital of Texas and home to a major university as well as an influential center for politics, technology, music, film and (increasingly) a food scene
nicknames: Live Music Capital of the World

tidbits: museum that chronicles the history of Texas with three themed exhibits: Land, Identity and Opportunity.
a beautiful building that shows off many of the natural resources which are so prevalent in Texas, such as limestone and the landscapes.
some of Texas' most prominent historical figures are buried in this cemetery.
ZACH Theatre is a professional theatre company located in Texas - the company is the oldest continuously active theatre company in Texas, and one of the ten oldest in the country.
located on a 30-acre site on The University of Texas, the LBJ Presidential Library is one of 14 presidential libraries administered by the National Archives and Records Administration.

Las Vegas.name: Las Vegas
Las Vegas.description: Las Vegas, officially the City of Las Vegas and often known simply as Vegas and located in the Mojave Desert of Southern Nevada, is the largest city in Nevada

tidbits: lined with upscale casino hotels, the neon-soaked Strip has gambling floors, vast hotel complexes with performance venues for music, comedy and circus-style acts. Attractions like the soaring, choreographed Fountains of Bellagio and the High Roller observation wheel draw crowds.
soaring, iconic fountains featuring dramatic aquatic shows choreographed with music & lights.
soaring, iconic fountains featuring dramatic aquatic shows choreographed with music & lights.
natural wonder with red rocks draws those looking to hike, rock climb or go for a scenic drive.
sprawling 24-hour mall featuring a huge LED canopy, casino & restaurant access & free entertainment.

steal: Red Rock Canyon National Conservation Area

Savannah.name: Savannah
Savannah.description: Savannah, oldest city in Georgia, is one of the few major cities in the South with antebellum charm and architecture remaining intact and has one of the largest historic districts in the country.
nicknames: Turf Grass Capital of the World
The Hostess City of the South

tidbits: this park borders Skidaway narrows, a part of Georgia’s intracoastal waterway. Trails wind through maritime forest and past salt marsh, leading to a boardwalk and observation tower.
the museum features military artifacts from the American Civil War to Desert Storm.
is your chance to experience the Gullah/Geechee from Georgia culture first hand.
the oldest Roman Catholic church in Georgia.

steal: Cathedral of St. John the Baptist

Portland.name: Portland
Portland.description: Portland is the largest city in Oregon and the second largest city in the Pacific Northwest after Seattle and is noted for its scenic beauty, great outdoors environment, a large number of microbreweries, and its eco-friendly urban planning policies

tidbits: steel suspension bridge that spans the Willamette River in Oregon
5,000+-acre wooded area with trails for hiking, biking & bird-watching, including a 30-mile route.
rotating exhibits give insight into state history, art & more in building with 8-story-high murals.
64-acre zoo featuring elephants, polar bears & other animal exhibits emphasizing conservation.

Cleveland.name: Cleveland
Cleveland.description: Cleveland, in Ohio, is a culturally diverse city on the shores of Lake Erie, one of the Great Lakes
nicknames: The Best Location in the Nation
The Rock and Roll Capital of the World

tidbits: Indians ballpark seats more than 43,000 people and features three levels of suites and a large-tiered stadium club.
tour the submarine responsible for the sinking of nearly 30,000 tons of Japanese ships during WWII.
ornate mausoleum with Lake Erie views housing the caskets of President James Garfield & family.
a restored 1925 Great Lakes freighter, open May to October for tours & exhibits.
iconic music-minded museum loaded with pop-culture memorabilia, artifacts, instruments & a jukebox.

Pittsburgh.name: Pittsburgh
Pittsburgh.description: Pittsburgh, in southwestern Pennsylvania, is situated at the confluence of the Monongahela and Allegheny Rivers, which meet to form the Ohio River; and it's unique terrain has resulted in an unusual city design and a hodge-podge of unique neighborhoods with diverse ethnic and architectural heritage

tidbits: museum where Warhol's art is the star & the inspiration for new works, performances & lectures.
museum & research center offers science-related exhibits, a planetarium, live shows & kids programs.
Schenley Park's horticulture hub features botanical gardens & a steel-&-glass Victorian greenhouse.
bird zoo with 500+ birds from 150+ species offers interactive encounters, feedings & party packages.
landmark museum featuring exhibits on dinosaur bones, geology & the impact of humans on ecosystems.

Salt Lake City.name: Salt Lake City
Salt Lake City.description: Salt Lake City, the capital and largest city of Utah, was thrust into world spotlight by the 2002 Winter Olympics

tidbits: home to two world-class ski resorts, legendary rock climbing routes, epic backcountry skiing access, hiking and mountain biking trails, and picnic areas straight out of an outdoor magazine.
whimsical, off-the-beaten-path public green space exhibiting original statues & engravings.
Liberty Park’s 8-acre aviary offers exhibits, shows & encounters where guests can view & feed birds.
modern, 42-acre zoo boasting hundreds of animals & tropical gardens, plus a train & carousel.
plaza owned by the Mormon church, with landscaped grounds, a visitors' center, walking tours & more.
modern venue with 10 galleries exploring earth science & Utah’s native cultures in a scenic locale.
